intro: Neobotrydium foetidum, commonly known as the stinking bladderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its small, fleshy leaves and distinctive, often foul-smelling flowers. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and is an aquatic or semi-aquatic species. Its flowers are usually greenish or yellowish, and they bloom in clusters. Neobotrydium foetidum plays a role in its ecosystem by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
